question_text: Which characteristic of coaxial cabling makes it particularly suitable for broadband cable modem service?
answer_options: It is immune to electromagnetic interference (EMI) due to fiber core
It uses shielding to minimize signal loss over long distances
It splits digital and analog signals on separate wires
correct_answer: It uses shielding to minimize signal loss over long distances
explanation: Coaxial cables have a central conductor and shielded layers, reducing signal degradation and making them suitable for broadband service.
